_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: Administrative controls and geographical isolation from plant with sensors

_exec_summary.SummaryText:

5. Mechanical Integrity Program - Milliken & Company has a comprehensive mechanical integrity program which applies to storage vessels, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, and pumps.
6. Management of Change (MOC) - Milliken & Company has an MOC program including written procedures to manage changes to process chemicals, technology, equipment, and procedures.
7. Compliance Audits - Audits are conducted on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rules are being complied with.
8. Incident Investigation - Milliken & Company investigates incidents that have resulted in, or could reasonably have resulted in a catastrophic release in an effort to identify root causes and to take actions to prevent a recurrence.
9. Employee Participation - Milliken & Company includes employees in the development of process hazards analyses and in the development of process safety management.
10. Hot Work Permits - Milliken & Company issues hot work permits for hot work operations conducted on or near the anhydrous ammonia covered process.
11. Contractors - Milliken & Company has a contractor approval program including an evaluation of the contractor's safety performance and programs. Contractors are informed of potential hazards associated with the process and follow safe work practices.

There have been no accidental releases from the anhydrous ammonia covered process at the Milliken & Company Magnolia Finishing Plant. The Magnolia Finishing Plant ammonia storage and handling process is a new process.

Milliken & Company is always seeking to improve safety procedures and practices. The Magnolia Finishing Plant ammonia storage and handling process is designed with current state-of-the-art safety systems, including control systems, safety interlocks, and alarm systems.

Milliken & Company is committed to safety and protection of the environment. Milliken & Company has established policies to ensure operations at the Magnolia Finishing Plant are conducted in accordance with safety and environmental regulations and current industry standards.

The Milliken & Company Magnolia Finishing Plant is located in Blacksburg, SC (Cherokee County). The anhydrous ammonia storage is associated with a textiles production process. The facility is located at an existing building located at 157 Milliken Road, Blacksburg, SC. 

At the Magnolia Finishing Plant, anhydrous ammonia arrives via truck and is stored on-site in a single 30,000 gallon storage tank. Ammonia is pumped to the textiles production process where it is used.

Milliken & Company maintains a robust accidental release prevention program. The program includes: 
1. Safety Information - Milliken & Company maintains physical details about the chemical processes such as toxicity and reactivity data, hazardous effects of inadvertent mixing, consequences of a deviation, process chemistry, design codes, and safety systems.
2. Process Hazard Analysis - Milliken & Company uses appropriate methods for performing Process Hazard Analyses. The analyses cover hazards of the process, identification of potential accidents, engineering and administrative controls, consequences of failure of controls, siting, and human factors, and include a qualitative evaluation of the health and safety impacts of control failure. At least one operator and one maintenance employee participate fully in the analyses.
3. Operating Procedures - Milliken & Company maintains specific instructions for the operators that includes information on startup, emergency shutdowns and other aspects of operation.
